intro: Paraboea glabrescens, commonly known as the slender paraboea, is a flowering plant native to the humid forests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and opposite, ovate leaves. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
